column4: hmm, the libc in edgy complains about my 2.4.36 kernel to be too old
the kernel -- it's in the 2.6 series now
we have a legacy kernel module here
well, for the sakes of keeping that module you are kind of depriving yourself from a whole bunch of software that requires functionality from the 2.6 kernel
do you have any new information for me, too?
out of curiosity, what's this legacy module you have?
it's a custom robot control module
right, and no available alternative for 2.6?
we are in the process of porting the module
for the time being we need a 2.4.x system where we can run our software builds from our feisty systems
and this means glibc >= 2.4 and glibc <= 2.5
well, i guess with this predicament, it's one way or another, no? i dont think you can have both
hmm? we got it to work on a gentoo box
if thats the case maybe you'd like to ask the guys in #ubuntu-devel
